snippet: Several securities law experts say the delay in the BlackBerry 10, and overly optimistic remarks by Research in Motion’s chief executive, may make the company a target of shareholder lawsuits.
abstract: Research in Motion chief executive Thorsten Heins is likely to face unfriendly shareholders at the firm's annual meeting; several securities law experts say the delay in the BlackBerry 10, and overly optimistic remarks by Heins, may make the company a target of shareholder lawsuits; shares have fallen about 95 percent from their peak in mid-2008.
lead_paragraph: Several securities law experts say the delay in the BlackBerry 10, and overly optimistic remarks by Research in Motion’s chief executive, may make the company a target of shareholder lawsuits.

headline.seo: BlackBerry’s Latest Delay Could Lead to Lawsuits
headline.main: BlackBerry’s Latest Delay Could Lead to Lawsuits
headline.print_headline: New Delays at RIM to Be Questioned at Meeting
